videoSnippet.title: Chess.com Buys Play Magnus!!! (+ Awesome Game)
videoSnippet.description:
Article and video here https://www.chess.com/news/view/chesscom-playmagnus

Have a great day :)

Wadsworth, Matthew J (2418) - Grieve, Harry (2390)
Chessable British Championship (chess24.com) [9] 2022.08.21
A13 English opening

1.c4 e6 2.g3 d5 3.Bg2 c6 4.Nf3 dxc4 5.Na3 b5 6.Nxb5 cxb5 7.Ng1 Bd7 8.Bxa8 Nc6 9.Bxc6 Bxc6 10.Nf3 Nf6 11.b3 Bc5 12.Bb2 Qd5 13.bxc4 bxc4 14.Bxf6 gxf6 15.Qc2 Ke7 16.Rc1 Ba3 17.Rb1 Bd6 18.Qc3 Qe4 19.Rc1 Bd5 20.Qa5 Ra8 21.Kf1 f5 22.h4 Qg4 23.Qc3 f4 24.gxf4 Rg8 25.Ke1 Bxf4 26.Qa3+ Kf6 27.Rf1 Rd8 28.Qc3+ e5 29.Rg1 Qh5 30.Qa5 Rd7 31.Qa6+ Ke7 32.Qa3+ Kf6 33.Rc2 Qf5 34.Rb2 Be6 35.Qc3 h6 36.Rb5 Qe4 37.Kd1 Bf5 38.Rb2 Rd3 39.exd3 Qxf3+ 40.Kc1 Bxd3 41.Rb4 Qxf2 42.Rh1 h5 43.Ra4 a5 44.Rd1 Qb6 45.Qb2 Qc5 46.Ra3 Kf5 47.Qc3 Qb5 48.Qb2 Qc6 49.Qc3 f6 50.Qxa5 Qb7 51.Rxd3 cxd3 52.Qc3 Qa6 53.Qb3 Ke4 54.a4 Kf3 55.Re1 Kf2 56.Re4 f5 57.Rc4 e4 58.Qc3 Ke2 59.a5 Qh6 60.Kb1 Bxd2 61.Qb2 Qe6 62.Rc5 f4 63.Qb5 f3 64.Re5 Qg6 65.a6 f2 66.Rf5 Be3 67.Qb2+ d2 68.a7 Qxf5 69.a8=Q f1=Q+ 70.Ka2 Qe6+ 71.Ka3 Bc5+ 72.Ka4 Qc4+ 73.Ka5 Qa1+ 74.Qxa1 Qb4+ 75.Ka6 Qb6#

00:00 Hello Everyone!
00:15 Big News!!!
02:00 Game Starts!
03:15 Completely New Game!
14:20 Pause the Video!
17:45 It Was In This Position!
19:08 Contributions!

The 2022 FTX Crypto Cup sees Magnus Carlsen, Alireza Firouzja, Levon Aronian, Anish Giri, Jan-Krzysztof Duda, Liem Le, Hans Niemann and Praggnanandhaa gather in the Eden Roc Miami Beach Hotel in Miami, Florida for the 2nd Major on the $1.6 million Meltwater Champions Chess Tour. $210,000 and a $100,000 Bitcoin bonus is at stake in the 7-round all-play-all tournament. Each match consists of 4 rapid games on the chess24 Playzone, with the winner earning $7,500 (3 points). If the match is tied there's a blitz tiebreak, with 2 blitz games followed, if needed, by a single Armageddon game. The winner earns $5,000 (2 points) and the loser $2,500 (1).

For each rapid game the players have 15 minutes for all their moves, with a 10-second increment after each move. For blitz games it's 5 minutes and a 3-second increment, while for the Armageddon game White has 5 minutes to Black's 4, but a draw counts as a win for Black. No draw offers are allowed before move 40. Official website: chess24.com/tour

judgment.name: Inaccuracy
judgment.comment: Checkmate is now unavoidable. Qb5+ was best.
